messages.subject: sorry about bikini thing (was Re: re:cult uniform)
messages.msgSnippet: ... painful ... If that was directed at me again, No Problem at all. I have had some of those days myself {namely today} AND I completely understand things
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, SandraDodd@a... wrote:
> Sorry to be a kneejerk type.

> So the example about kids not tearing things up just struck me in a
painful
> place.
>
> My edginess. Sorry.
>
> Sandra
>
>

If that was directed at me again, No Problem at all. I have had some
of those days myself {namely today} AND I completely understand
things need to be clear when we state things so that others
understand. If you misunderstood there is a good chance someone else
did too. Feel free anytime ask for a re-explaination or to question
what I meant, and I'll do my best to give it to ya. :-)
Tracy

messages.subject: sorry about bikini thing (was Re: re:cult uniform)
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry to be a kneejerk type. I ve had a couple of private e-mails lately, NOT from people on thislist (I don t think; it didn t seem) which were somewhat
messages.messageBody:
Sorry to be a kneejerk type.

I've had a couple of private e-mails lately, NOT from people on thislist (I
don't think; it didn't seem) which were somewhat cranky about things like (for
a fictional example):I thought unschooling should create great musicians, and
ever since I've been letting the kids pick their own music curriculum, I...
wah wah wah.

So the example about kids not tearing things up just struck me in a painful
place.

My edginess. Sorry.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
